content: “What would happen [Mr. Obama] if, God forbid, your two daughters were kidnapped by Al Qaeda?” FOX News analyst, Bo Dietl demanded an answer to that hypothetical question because he’d like to know… in fact, we’d all like to know! But let’s take Dietl’s hypothetical question a step further. What would happen if we knew the men who staged the kidnapping were members of a world-wide ring of cutthroat terrorists and we had some of their ringleaders in custody? What would happen if members of our intelligence community questioned these terrorists aggressively… deprived them of sleep, locked them up in a small dark room … poured some water in their mouths for a few seconds - all in order to coerce them to divulge information that ACTUALLY SAVED THE LIVES of his precious daughters? Do you believe, for one minute, that President Obama would look at these U.S. intelligence agents in utter disgust and say ”Thank you for saving the lives of my girls but your tactics are never called for under any circumstances. And despite the fact that you were following orders from your superiors, the U.S. Government is going to release the details of everything you did for the whole world to see… then we might throw you in jail for doing your job.” Do you believe that Obama would retaliate against these U.S. interrogators by publishing photographs of them questioning the terrorists so that other members of this terrorist ring could then retaliate against these interrogators and their families? Well guess what? THAT IS EFFECTIVELY WHAT BARACK OBAMA JUST DID when he chose to release classified legal memos detailing the interrogation techniques used on high value detainees in the aftermath of 9/11 - allowing the possibility of prosecution and certainty of persecution of those involved. For the rest of the story use the URL **http://www.cfiflistmanager.net/memos1.html** SEABEE'S "CAN DO", "HAVE DONE", AND WILL DO SO FOREVER. GOD BLESS AMERICA

content: A father will do anything for his children... and that kinda scares me. IF this hypothetical situation occured, I worry that Obama would recklessly put soldiers in danger to do "anything and everything" to get his daughters back. But then again with the vast amount of advisors at his disposal it could be totally different. I think there are too many unknowns to give a good answer.

title: What would happen [Mr. Obama] if, God forbid

content: I think Obama would do whatever it takes to protect his family, but will he do the same for my family? He is capable of making the hard call, you saw him give the OK for the pirates?? ...and they want to put Bush in jail for soaking a few heads to get info to protect us from attack for 8 years???!!! Obama does not waste time soaking heads and asking questions to get info, he just kills them flat out. I know that is dramatic and kinda mean but it was to make a point. They would have been all over Bush if he has made that call and where is the out cry from the left on Obama using force to protect America? You also see Obama talk tough with Pakastan, I don't think he is a push over, but unfortunately, it might take another attack on us to make the Dem's get it. I think deep down, Obama gets it, but at the end of the day, his hands are tied by his party, pity.

title: What would happen [Mr. Obama] if, God forbid

content: Well, let's turn this question sideways for a minute. What would happen if regular gangsters kidnapped your children, and held them ransom, and threatened to kill them. They might even kill them. That would be indescribably bad, no better than terrorists taking them, really. You might very well want to hunt them down and kill them. If you had access to someone with information, you might torture them. If you did, you would face criminal charges. Extenuating circumstances might lessen your sentence, but the charge would still stand. The fact that you had committed a crime would still remain. The rule of law takes justice out of the hands of individuals who, to put it nicely, might not be objective about things they were personally the victims of. It takes reprisal and revenge away and replaces it with a system of society which (ideally) uncovers the truth. Justice is no longer individual, it is societal. (And that's generally a good thing, because when justice was individual it was more often the person with more power that won a case than the person who was innocent.) Terrorism isn't any different. We address the problems posed by terrorists as a society, not as individuals seeking revenge. As individuals we might be tempted to use some pretty nasty tactics if people we loved were harmed. As a society, we should face these problems more objectively, and should not let revenge or reprisal or especially fear unduly impact our decisions.

content: Does anyone know of a man from the United States who bowed to a king from some other country? No? Does anyone know of any POTUS whom has bowed to a king from some other country? I checked on former POTUS, None have bowed to a king. I wonder what the rest of the world thinks of the United States! I wonder if leaders of other countries are snickering and shaking their heads! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
